text: this is a very well-known brand this not
so much my bak traces its luxury lineage
to 1909 in 1960 Daimler Benz bought the
mark where it lied dormant until the
2004 model year the resurrected Maybach
produced cars averaging 420 thousand
dollars a copy running headlong into the
Great Recession the brand sank like
Lehman Brothers Maybach is now an ultra
luxury sub brand of mercedes-benz much
like AMG is performance and it's more
affordable though at two hundred and
four thousand dollars is tested I'm
guessing not many buyers are cross
shopping it with Camry and Accord think
of the long Regal Maybach as an
overachieving s-class with the wheelbase
stretched nearly eight inches to benefit
those in the rear taking on Bentley
Mulsanne and rolls-royce ghost Maybach
is richly appointed cameras can't do the
LED light piping justice the BER mr.
audio system looks as dramatic as it
sounds my Bach owners will probably
spend an awful lot of time back here so
I will too the seats are heated and
cooled they have a massage feature and
they're infinitely adjustable right down
to power leg rests making this the
fastest and most luxurious lazyboy on
the planet
each seat gets its own useful table
you'll have expect a flight attendant to
arrive with artisan charcuterie all
sorts of things can be controlled back
here that would include climate + cooled
and heated cupholders to celebrate
corporate takeovers there are Rob and
burking silver-plated flutes and don't
worry they won't tip over in tight turns
of course there's a fridge to keep your
bubbly perfectly chilled I'm going to
guess these are made more for wine or
champagne but this is all I have
here's a six liter Biturbo v12
gracefully summons 523 horsepower and
612 pound-feet of torque imperceptible
gear shifts come from a 7-speed
automatic the chauffeur gets paddle
shifters powered by the back wheels
Maybach is not slow this machine
whispers up to sixty miles an hour in
about five seconds and I do mean
whisperer it's very quiet so is the
design which is quite understated though
Maybach seems to draw attention wherever
it goes drive a Honda Civic if you want
to go unnoticed some cars have
adjustable suspensions Maybach has magic
body control their words not mine
cameras look ahead at the road and scan
for things like up holes then the system
preps the suspension for when the tires
hit it the ride quality can only be
described as serene it is not sloppy
though Maybach feels lighter on its feet
than you might imagine
fuel economy is not my box strength that
shouldn't surprise gulping premium the
EPA rates it at 13 city 20 highway even
with the auto start/stop feature on
it's my biggest gripe since startup is a
little sluggish it can be turned off
those rare occasions where owners right
up front will be enlightening small
impressive touches are everywhere seats
don't just massage the side bolsters are
active to hold passengers in place when
cornering the command user interface has
not been my favorite but it is better
now with a touchpad that allows for page
swipes and the ability to enter text by
writing got to love that refrigerator
until something large needs to go into
the trunk celebrating good times puts a
chill on practicality keep in mind it's
somewhat easy to remove four bundles for
a car this size it's the only place the
S 600 Maybach doesn't impress if you can
afford the base price of one hundred and
ninety thousand dollars but compared to
Molson and ghosts that's akin to scoring
an Hermes briefcase at Nordstrom Rack my
BOC has been down for the count twice in
the past looks like the third time is a
charm
Oh
Oh
